text: 13.97 Tower Hamlets is predominantly served by combined sewers, draining foul and surface water discharges towards Thames Waterâ€™s Beckton Sewage Treatment Works. Combined sewer overflows discharge excess water to the Thames during heavy storm events, even after the Tideway tunnel is completed. To accommodate additional foul drainage from new development in the existing sewers, surface water discharges from sites need to be reduced. The construction of new sewers is not viable due to significant below ground congestion in many areas, delivery timescales, disruption, and cost.
